unnormalised: ## Kachra Chronicles: Let's Talk Waste Management, Yaar!
normalised: Hash Kachra Chronicles: Let's Talk Waste Management, Yaar!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk about something we all deal with every single day – waste! From leftover roti sabzi to that pile of old newspapers (remember those?), we generate a lot of *kachra*. And how we manage it impacts not just our neighborhoods like, say, Bandra or Karol Bagh, but the whole planet.
normalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk about something we all deal with every single day – waste! From leftover roti sabzi to that pile of old newspapers (remember those?), we generate a lot of kachra. And how we manage it impacts not just our neighborhoods like, say, Bandra or Karol Bagh, but the whole planet.

unnormalised: Think about it: overflowing landfills, polluted rivers like the Ganga, and stray animals scavenging for food. It's not a pretty picture, is it? Especially around Diwali time with all the extra sweet boxes and discarded wrapping paper.
normalised: Think about it: overflowing landfills, polluted rivers like the Ganga, and stray animals scavenging for food. It's not a pretty picture, is it? Especially around Diwali time with all the extra sweet boxes and discarded wrapping paper.

unnormalised: So, what can we do? Well, a lot, actually!
normalised: So, what can we do? Well, a lot, actually!

unnormalised: First, let's embrace the three R's: Reduce, Reuse, and Recycle. Instead of buying bottled water, carry your own bottle (like a cool copper one, perhaps?). Repurpose old sarees into shopping bags – your Nani would be proud! And make sure you're separating your dry and wet waste. The local BMC workers will thank you, believe me. Remember that garbage collection scheduled for 07:00 hrs every morning? Let's be ready.

unnormalised: Next up: composting! Got a small balcony garden? Perfect! You can easily compost your kitchen scraps and turn them into nutrient-rich soil for your plants. Think of all the awesome organic vegetables you can grow! My friend, Priya from IIT Delhi, is doing some amazing research on composting methods. You can check her work online sometime after 22/01/2024.

unnormalised: And finally, let’s pressure businesses to be more responsible. Support companies that prioritize sustainable packaging and responsible disposal methods. Don't hesitate to complain to your local municipality if you see illegal dumping – remember, the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan is all about collective responsibility. We need to be more mindful after festivals like Holi – all that coloured powder and plastic waste needs to be handled correctly.
